conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each entry point (A, B, C, and D) to the containers.
Liquid flows from A (Blue) from the top left, moving downward and to the right.
Liquid from A will pass through the blue baffle and continue downward, likely flowing into container E.
Liquid flows from B (Yellow) from the top center, moving downward and to the right.
Liquid from B will pass through the yellow baffle and continue downward, likely flowing into container F.
Liquid flows from C (Green) from the top center, moving downward and to the left.
Liquid from C will pass through the green baffle and continue downward, likely flowing into container F.
Liquid flows from D (Orange) from the top right, moving downward and to the left.
Liquid from D will pass through the orange baffle and continue downward, likely flowing into container G.
Container E will receive liquid from A.
Container F will receive liquid from B and C.
Container G will receive liquid from D.
Liquid will flow into containers E, F, and G from the respective entry points A, B, C, and D.
